oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Man hauling bags in a steamboat
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: African American man balances and caries a heavy cloth bag of unidentified goods, possibly peanuts, on his back. Behind him another man carries the same. Rows of stuffed cloth bags and barrels of goods are pictured.

Peanuts were common cargo shipped by steamboat. "Roustabouts" were men who handled freight on the commercial steamers that plied Southern rivers after the Civil War. Many worked at the river landings where the boats called.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; Barrels; Bags; Steamboats; Laborers
